data.title: Excellent regional orchestra punches above its weight
data.text: A Columbus Symphony Orchestra concert is an excellent way to enjoy big city sound at a small town price.  I attended 4 of the Columbus Symphony Orchestra's 7 concerts last season and I enjoyed each of them thoroughly.  Each of the concerts had a unique theme and Conductor George Del Gobo did a nice job of balancing popular, crowd pleasing pieces of music with less frequently heard and very interesting music.  As I understand it, the symphony pulls talented musicians from all over Georgia and Alabama for each concert which, I believe, contributes to the quality of the ensemble- an ensemble you would expect to find in a much larger city.  If you are attending one of the "Masterworks" series concerts, be sure to arrive early so that you can hear Maestro Del Gobo's orientation to the concert which he calls "Know the Score."  During these orientations, Del Gobo provides concert goers with cues to listen for in the music, an explanation of the historical context of many of the pieces, and answers questions from the audience.  Del Gobo is intimately familiar with all of the pieces the orchestra plays so his notes on cues, moments, and textures within the music are fascinating but these informal orientations are most remarkable for the historical context he provides for each piece- the man has virtually encyclopedic knowledge of music history.  I would reccomend the CSO to any and all music lovers living in or visiting the Chattahoochee Valley.  Final note: children's tickets to the concerts are only $5, but families with young children who need to be in bed before the end of a concert or who may not sit so well through an entire concert can also attend the orchestra's rehearsals held the day of the concert at 12:30 PM.

data.title: Music City Hit Makers
data.text: I visited the Orchestra for their collaboration with the Music City Hit Makers back on Feb. 14th, 2015. It was a beautiful way to spend my Valentines evening! The facility was absolutely stunning and the staff were very happy and helpful! I really enjoyed the evening and will be back for future performances!

data.title: You like music?
data.text: If you answered yes to the title of this review then you must visit. The staff were knowledgeable  and friendly. Columbus is a great city with a fantastic arts community in the downtown area. The organization is well run and the performances are top notch. You like music? Do yourself a favor and go. If you're traveling through this charming city, make your visit complete, and go see a concert at this beautiful venue.

data.title: The stings of my heart!
data.text: The crown jewel of Columbus' cultural arts scene is the Columbus Symphony. The organization pre-dates the Civil War, for goodness sake. When I hear "stay tuned" I know bigger and better melodies are coming to all of us from these wonderful musicians! Thanks to a great staff that is always scheming up something creative and unique. Cheers!

data.title: Quality of big city at 1/3rd the cost
data.text: It's tempting to think that quality performances only happen in the biggest cities. Not true with the Columbus Symphony! Each season has an offering for everyone, from popular classics to less common pieces, and they also offer special events each year that are great to introduce classical music to children and others. The conductor is fun, the guest performances are delightful, and the venue has spectacular acoustics.

data.title: Retired band director
data.text: The Columbus Symphony Orchestra is an absolute top-notch, high-quality performing musical ensemble within the Bi-State area. Their varied programs are suited for people of all ages and genre interests. Under the outstanding leadership of musical director, George Del Gobbo, this group has developed into a premier orchestra that Columbus should be very proud to call their own.

data.title: Great events
data.text: This symphony is a great find!  The programs are diverse and always entertaining.  I would recommend checking them out when you are in town.

data.title: Wonderful music, wonderful events
data.text: Check your calender. If you're looking for great entertainment, you can't go wrong with one of the Symphony's performances. Their outstanding staff puts together great events, much more than just exceptional music. It's always a fun evening.
